name: Budapest Hotel

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel and were given our room immediately, the staff are pleasant and helpful. Hotel rooms are very basic and very dated but OK. This is a very big hotel and if you get a room at the end of it then it is a long walk to and from your room every day.
reviews.title: Central Moscow

reviews.text: Breakfast was nice, the normal cold meats, cheeses and hot foods (sausages, bacon, eggs etc.) Very good selection of fresh bread.
reviews.title: everything is excelent-location,staff, food

reviews.text: The food and drinks in the hotel are expensive, but Moscow is expensive.
reviews.title: CONVENIENT LOCATION, BUT QUITE EXPENSIVE, AND TERRIBLE LOUD NOISE

reviews.text: The hotel is close to Red Square, about 15 minutes walk, and a metro station isn't far away. Places to eat close to the hotel - 50mtr up the street is a nice restaurant, not so expensive and good service. The top of the street and almost opposite is a restaurant call Sherbit - nice food good atmosphere and open 24hrs. For a real treat in Moscow, but on your best clothes and head for Cafe Pushkin, this is the place to be seen and the food is probably the beat is Moscow. It isn't cheap but then not the most expensive around £25 per head + drinks (expensive). Enjoy the atmosphere in Cafe Pushkin.
reviews.title: Great location, very average basic hotel.

reviews.text: Taxi - easy to get, stand at the side of the road and put your finger out pointing at the ground, and a private car will stop and you negotiate a price BEFORE YOU GET IN... average price is 300-500 rubles. Have your hotel business card with you in Russian so as to avoid confusion. I was with my 15year old daughter and I felt quite safe, though some people who are a little sensitive may want to ask the restaurant or hotel to organise a car. The cars that you pick up on the street can range from a 25 year old Volga car (Russian Tank in design) to a brand new Ford and more. The Volga is brilliant, traditional Russian car with real wood trim inside in an accident this would be my choice of car.
reviews.title: Good value - watch your bill

reviews.text: Arrived at Shremetovo airport at 4am so had to take a taxi. Driver did not speak or read English and could not find the hotel when shown the address: a bit scary! Hotel itself large and a couple of blocks behind the Bolshoi Theatre close to several great stations on the great Moscow underground. My single room was small but fine, with those hard matresses and thin downies that tell you you are in a former socialist state. The hotel has a breakfast room serving a good Euro buffet breakfast (herring, salmon, buns). There is a first floor bar that was expensive and quiet, and a lobby bar which has all the things you would expect to find in an Eastern European lobby bar.
reviews.title: Bsic hotel very close to the central sites.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Expensive by Australian standards but great central location, close to Bolshoi Theatre and restaurants with good affordable meals.
reviews.title: Great central location

reviews.text: Easy walk to Red Square, shops and Metro. We felt very safe in the area by day and night, but we were prepared for pickpockets, as in any city.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Good buffet breakfast. Friendly, helpful English speaking reception staff.
reviews.title: great value in expensive moscow

reviews.text: Room was very comfortable with good bathroom.
reviews.title: It's Moscow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed total of 5 nights here and was very happy with choice. Hotel location is fantastic. Other nearby hotels are expensive. Budapest seems to be reasonably priced and is still very close to major attractions. Red Square is about a 10 minute walk. Breakfast buffet (included) was very good, complete with hot items. Beds don't seem like they would be comfortable, but ended up being fine. Older, tired European-hotel decor, but it worked for us. Heard some slight music from "gentlemen's club" next door first night, but wasn't really problem. Our 2nd room had terribly ugly view of interior rooftop, but since we were never in room, wasn't a huge deal. Would use own toiletries, but bathrooms were clean and surprisingly spacious. Again, would stay here again in heartbeat - great breakfast and location, location, location!
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable hotel

reviews.text: We were at the Budapest Hotel for three nights. Checkin was efficient but perfunctory. For some reason we were upgraded, so the rooms were quite spacious. Furnishings were basic but all encompassing. Breakfast buffet was quite nice and comprehensive, and service there was friendly and responsive. We had a snack in the bar, which was also nice. Bathrooms were large, good showers, good towels. Good air conditioning system. Very good location for exploring central Moscow, near Red Square.
reviews.title: Good base for exploring Moscow

reviews.text: Stayed here for three days in May/June 2009. Price was $150 per night, and at that price, this hotel cannot be beat. Five minutes walk from the Bolshoi and Metro, and 10 minutes walk to Red Square. Furniture a little dated, but everything was clean, and staff was very helpful and friendly. English speaking was not a problem. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Could not be a better location. Would stay here again and recommend to others.
reviews.title: Great Location in Center of City
i'm going here again!
reviews.text: this was a nice friendly hotel..it can be hard especially when the staff does not speak english but there was no language barrior since sign language did the trick!
First of all - location. It`s difficult to find the better one so close to Tverskaya, Red Square or Pushkin Square.
reviews.title: Very decent option in the centre of Moscow

reviews.text: The Budapest Hotel was a big, old hotel a five minute walk from the Bolshoi Theater. It's lobby was nice and the staff pleasant. Our room was huge and "Old World". (My husband, who had been to Moscow before, said it was better than he had expected!) There wasn't a breakfast room in the hotel, so breakfast was brought to our room on plastic trays! Everything was in a package - milk, yogurt, juice, croissants, the cereal was already in the bowl. The fresh food was two pieces of white bread with cheese and meat in plastic containers. It was a real surprise for such a large, expensive hotel! I would have expected more for the price but the location was good.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: I stayed in Budapest Hotel for 4 nights. My room was an individual room. The size was decent, with a desk and a chair besides the bed, and the bathroom was ample and recently renovated. As hotel prices go in Moscow this hotel is a good value. The internet conexion was expensive (20€ per day) but it worked perfectly. The location of the hotel is excellent, less than 15 minutes walk to Red Square. Also within 10 minutes walk you have several underground stations, which is the best way to move around in moscow. The hotel has a pub, no restaurant, but if you step out to the street there are plenty choices within walking distance. Overall it is a good value considering the very high prices for hotel rooms in Moscow. At least this one is conveniently located.
reviews.title: Great location, decent price

likes.disliked: — price, like all hotels in moscow

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel & really enjoyed it. I stayed for 3 nights in Dec. '07. I prearranged an airport p/u for $50 each way, which was excellent. This hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Red Square. The whole area around this hotel & the Red Square was very nice, w/ Beverly Hills type stores. The room had a high ceiling, large bed, a high window, refrig. TV, ornate bedspread, & decorations, & everything you would expect. The bathroom had a shower stall only, no tub, but hair dryer & everything else. The off season rate was something like $175, for my first night, Sun. due to their weekend discount, & $225 for Mon. & Tues., both taxes & all included. I booked through their website which was cheaper than Orbitz, Expedia, etc. They do have a restaurant in the lobby that I did not eat at. I ate one meal in the bar, which was strange, but gave a good flavor of communist type food. It was a mixed plate, w/ little sausages, a few squirts of ketchup & mustart on the side, beets, & a little canned peas. The borst soup was OK. One prostitute was in the bar, & 2 "goon" looking bartenders. I had a few beers in the bar several times, too. The in-room frig. was stocked w/ beer, wine, bottled H20, etc. They say not to drink the H20 in Moscow, & there is a nice convenience store up the street & to the right, for 2 litters of bottled water for the equiv. of $1. The front desk people smiled, but did not seem too concerned about where to point you for restaurants, $ exchange booths, or what not. One of the bell hops yelled at me in Russian after I accidently went down the service elevator. Oops! I didn't know. But I tipped another bell hop on arrival well, & it seemed like he was telling the "yeller" to leave me alone in Russian. The TV channels were good. I enjoyed watching the Russian shows. They had European CNN & MTV, I think, too. I really liked this hotel. The Marriott down the street was something like $750, & other hotels in Dec., farther away, were around $350. I never did find this cafetaria that sells Russian food for cheap, & wish I did. The mini-bar frig. was cheap. Most of the restaurants were $50-100. I had a cheeseburger at the Marriott for $30. But there were little convenience stores that sell snacks, sandwiches, etc. that are cheap. After all the locals have to pay the prices. Compared to Alaska, where we are used to paying high prices for everything, I didn't find Moscow expensive. Overall, I really liked this hotel. And, I absolutely loved Moscow! I wish I had more than 3 nights, 4 days there. I always travel off season, & found this hotel to be a good bargain. I probably wouldn't want to pay their in-season rates. However, I would still find it worth it due to the high costs of the other hotels. Oh yeah, & the breakfast was strange, but not bad. They were always a little "off" w/ their delivery timing. 10, 20, or 30 minutes. It was prepackaged cereal, muffin, a mini caraffe of coffee or tea-you choose at check-in. I do not remember any hot items. However, it also gave the flavor of communist style Russia, where the food is not what we are used to in the West. This is one of the reasons why I went to Moscow, to see how things were/are different. Unfortunately, I did not see this, being near the Red Square, where everything is nice & sort of opulant. I did not really see the dreary high rise apartment buildings, etc. Yet, judging from other's poor experiences in sub-par hotels, it was probably a good thing that I did not experience this first hand.
reviews.title: Old World Charm

likes.liked: — Location. Quality for price. Ornate/Old World Charm.
likes.disliked: — Staff could have been friendly & more accommodating to point out bars/restaurants, etc. Better food in restaurant would have made it more convenient. An area that served a hot breakfast, that allowed for more than 1 cup of coffee, would have made the experience more enjoyable.

reviews.text: I recently spent 4 nights at Hotel Budapest in Moscow and my impression is that the hotel is a good budget hotel.
reviews.title: Good location, OK rooms & strange breakfast

reviews.text: The location could not be much better, maybe except for National
reviews.title: Incompetent staff

description: The Budapest Hotel is excellently located in the very heart of Moscow, just steps away from the Bolshoi and Maly Theaters, Red Square, the Kremlin museums. The hotel was built in 1876 by the architect Freidenberg and now it is a cultural value of Moscow city.The Hotel has 116 rooms, including 51 Standard Single, 20 Standard Double, 37 Deluxe and 8 Premium Suite. Each of them is individually designed and decorated. All rooms are equipped with air-conditioned, a bathtub or a shower, telephone, satellite TV, a mini bar, safe box, a hairdryer, Internet access. All rooms are 100 % non-smoking.
